greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A(n,k) is the sum over all Dyck paths of semilength n of products over all peaks p of (k*x_p+y_p)/y_p, where x_p and y_p are the coordinates of peak p; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
comment: A Dyck path of semilength n is a (x,y)-lattice path from (0,0) to (2n,0) that does not go below the x-axis and consists of steps U=(1,1) and D=(1,-1). A peak of a Dyck path is any lattice point visited between two consecutive steps UD.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..140, flattened
maple: b:= proc(x, y, t, k) option remember; `if`(y>x or y<0, 0,
mathematica: Table[Table[A[n, d - n], {n, 0, d}], {d, 0, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 23 2016, translated from Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, May 23 2015
